SENT.plain: Deep cerebral vein thrombosis can present with acute, severe neurological symptoms and may be rapidly fatal as in the 20-year-old woman reported here
Although MRI is superior for establishing the diagnosis, CT is usually the first examination performed in the clinical setting
It is therefore important to recognise certain indicators such as extensive bithalamic low density
These and certain other less specific signs are correlated with the MRI and autopsy findings
